1.instruction:
Design database schema for the multi-user bidding notification system. Include:
1. Users table (user_id, username, email, password_hash, created_at, updated_at)
2. User preferences table (preference_id, user_id, search_conditions in JSON format, created_at, updated_at)
3. Saved searches table (search_id, user_id, search_name, filters in JSON, created_at)
Create an ER diagram and document the schema design with field descriptions, data types, and relationships.
Save the design document to /workspace/backend/docs/database_schema.md

2.instruction:
Create Python FastAPI backend with async functionality. Requirements:
1. Use Python FastAPI framework with async/await
2. Implement async API calls to 나라장터 API (https://apis.data.go.kr/1230000/ad/BidPublicInfoService/getBidPblancListInfoCnstwkPPSSrch)
3. Store ServiceKey in backend environment variables (.env file)
4. Implement user authentication (registration, login, JWT tokens)
5. Create endpoints for: user registration, login, saving search preferences, retrieving saved preferences, searching bid notifications
6. Use SQLite or PostgreSQL for database
7. Implement CORS to allow frontend connections
8. Follow the database schema from task 1 at /workspace/backend/docs/database_schema.md
Save all backend code to /workspace/backend/ directory
Create requirements.txt with all dependencies

3.instruction:
Refactor the existing React frontend (located in /workspace/shadcn-ui/) to work with the new backend:
1. Remove direct API calls to 나라장터 API
2. Replace with API calls to the FastAPI backend created in task 2
3. Add user registration and login pages with forms
4. Add authentication state management (store JWT token)
5. Add user preference management UI (save/load search conditions)
6. Modify SearchForm component to load saved preferences on login
7. Add logout functionality
8. Update API service layer to include authentication headers
Keep existing UI components and styling, only modify the data fetching logic and add authentication features.
The backend API will be running on http://localhost:8000

4.instruction:
Integration testing and documentation:
1. Test the complete flow: user registration → login → save search preferences → search bid notifications → view results
2. Verify async API calls are working correctly
3. Test authentication and authorization
4. Create a comprehensive README.md with:
   - System architecture overview
   - Setup instructions for backend and frontend
   - Environment variable configuration
   - API endpoint documentation
   - User guide for running the application
5. Create a deployment guide for production environment
Save documentation to /workspace/README.md
